title: Android Weekly Issue #654
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Solving ANRs with OpenTelemetry While OpenTelemetry is the new observability standard, it lacks official support for many mobile concepts like ANRs. Learn how Embrace's engineering team adapted its ANR data capture approach to align with OpenTelemetry, including the challenges, benefits, and opportunities for future improvements. Immutable lists and how they protect your Android app from crashing Elyes Mansour shows how to use immutable lists to describe collections in our state objects to protect them against accidental mutations. Naming is Hard Romain Guy looks at another seemingly small or irrelevant change that can have a large impact on performance. Sponsored Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Kotlin Coroutines: Fix 'Optimised Out' Variables Tom Sabel shows how to dynamically enable debug-friendly settings using the idea.active property, ensuring you can inspect coroutine variables without impacting production performance. Is reflection slowing down your code? Marcin Moskała decided to make some benchmarks to see how reflection really performs. What's new in CameraX 1.4.0 and a sneak peek of Jetpack Compose support Get ready to level up your Android camera apps! CameraX 1.4.0 just dropped with a load of awesome new features and improvements. How Instagram enabled users to take stunning Low Light Photos When users on Android take a photo in low light environments, they’ll see a moon icon that allows them to activate Night Mode for better image quality. Learn how this is implemented. Selectively running Android UI tests Segun Famisa shows how to selectively perform checks on specific tests and perform those checks only under certain conditions. Back to the Future: Compose Previewing Your XML-Based Views! Sergio Sastre Florez shows how Compose Previews can actually be used with XML-based Views. A primer into native interactions in Compose Multiplatform apps Anil Kumar Beesetti explores how to set up and use the expect/actual pattern and Koin to create a SystemService that handles interactions seamlessly across platforms. Say Hello to 'Compose Hot Reload' Sebastian Sellmair takes a close look at the technology behind 'Compose Hot Reload'. Writing Maintainable and Readable Tests with MockK - Part 5 of 5 Sandeep Kella wraps up the series discussing best practices for writing tests that are maintainable, readable, and efficient when using MockK. Kotlin companion object explained Michal Ankiersztajn teaches what a companion object is, how it behaves and what you can use it for in Kotlin! Wrapping Android XR For KMP One of the biggest benefits of KMP is how seamless it is to provide platform specific functionality for your shared code. Adam McNeilly does that with Android XR. Jobs Senior Android Engineer (New York, NY) Behance gives creatives everything they need to showcase their work, find opportunities, and get paid. You will join an agile team of mobile engineers shipping native apps, quickly integrating new technologies like Jetpack Compose, and shepherding the Adobe app ecosystem into the future. Libraries & Code app-sizer A tool designed to analyze the download size of Android applications. Provides detailed insights into app binary composition through a Gradle plugin and CLI tool to help developers optimize app size and improve user acquisition. Klibs.io — Search 1400+ KMP libraries A new service designed to make finding Kotlin Multiplatform libraries faster and easier. gadulka A minimalistic player library for Kotlin Multiplatform. It targets Android, jvm and iOS, allowing consumers to play audio files News The Second Developer Preview of Android 16 The second developer preview of Android 16 is now available to test with your apps Introducing klibs.io: A New Way to Discover Kotlin Multiplatform Libraries Ekaterina Petrova introduces klibs.io – JetBrains' new service designed to make finding Kotlin Multiplatform libraries faster and easier. Tools FIR Tree Plugin for JetBrains IDEs Visualize the FIR (Frontend Intermediate Representation) and CFG (Control Flow Graph) from a Kotlin file Videos & Podcasts Multi-dollar String Interpolation in Kotlin | $$ Kotlin’s string interpolation has been a much-liked feature from the beginning, and in this video, learn about how JetBrains is adding more flexibility to it with multi-dollar string interpolation. Kotlin 2.1 - Pattern Guards, Swift Export, and More! Dave Leeds checks in on the latest news from the Kotlin and Android worlds and explore some rad new features in Kotlin 2.1 like pattern guards and (a very early peek at) direct Swift export. How to Draw On a Canvas In Jetpack Compose Philipp Lackner teaches how you can draw custom paths in a Jetpack Compose canvas. XR Unlocked '24 in under 8 minutes Google announced Android XR at XR Unlocked. Get a firsthand look at the new platform for headsets and glasses. Build immersive apps & experiences with OpenXR & Unity Android XR builds on the Android tradition of supporting industry standards and tools familiar to XR developers. Adapting Android apps for XR Learn how to build new XR differentiated apps and how to adapt existing Android apps for Android XR devices. Designing apps for Android XR Learn how to design intuitive and engaging apps for Android XR
text: While OpenTelemetry is the new observability standard, it lacks official support for many mobile concepts like ANRs. Learn how Embrace's engineering team adapted its ANR data capture approach to align with OpenTelemetry, including the challenges, benefits, and opportunities for future improvements. Romain Guy looks at another seemingly small or irrelevant change that can have a large impact on performance. One of the biggest benefits of KMP is how seamless it is to provide platform specific functionality for your shared code. Adam McNeilly does that with Android XR. Behance gives creatives everything they need to showcase their work, find opportunities, and get paid. You will join an agile team of mobile engineers shipping native apps, quickly integrating new technologies like Jetpack Compose, and shepherding the Adobe app ecosystem into the future. A tool designed to analyze the download size of Android applications. Provides detailed insights into app binary composition through a Gradle plugin and CLI tool to help developers optimize app size and improve user acquisition. A minimalistic player library for Kotlin Multiplatform. It targets Android, jvm and iOS, allowing consumers to play audio files Kotlin’s string interpolation has been a much-liked feature from the beginning, and in this video, learn about how JetBrains is adding more flexibility to it with multi-dollar string interpolation. ]]>
html:
While OpenTelemetry is the new observability standard, it lacks official support for many mobile concepts like ANRs. Learn how Embrace's engineering team adapted its ANR data capture approach to align with OpenTelemetry, including the challenges, benefits, and opportunities for future improvements.

Romain Guy looks at another seemingly small or irrelevant change that can have a large impact on performance.

One of the biggest benefits of KMP is how seamless it is to provide platform specific functionality for your shared code. Adam McNeilly does that with Android XR.

Behance gives creatives everything they need to showcase their work, find opportunities, and get paid. You will join an agile team of mobile engineers shipping native apps, quickly integrating new technologies like Jetpack Compose, and shepherding the Adobe app ecosystem into the future.

A tool designed to analyze the download size of Android applications. Provides detailed insights into app binary composition through a Gradle plugin and CLI tool to help developers optimize app size and improve user acquisition.

A minimalistic player library for Kotlin Multiplatform. It targets Android, jvm and iOS, allowing consumers to play audio files

Kotlin’s string interpolation has been a much-liked feature from the beginning, and in this video, learn about how JetBrains is adding more flexibility to it with multi-dollar string interpolation.

]]>
